document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the Bark Beetle Genera Within the Former Cryphalini (Curculionidae: Scolytinae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
⊇
Cryphalus sinoabietis opienensis Tsai and Li, 1963: 607
.

=
Margadillius terminaliae Browne, 1984c: 450
syn. nov.
(secondary homonym).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks: A replacement name is proposed for
Margadillius terminaliae Browne, 1984c
because the name is already occupied by
Cryphalus terminaliae Browne, 1980b
. The replacement name is a toponym derived from the type locality.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
=
Cryphalus densepilosus Schedl, 1943: 36
syn. nov.
(secondary homonym).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks: A replacement name is proposed for
Cryphalus densepilosus Schedl, 1943
because the name is now occupied by
Hypocryphalus densepilosus Schedl, 1942d
. The replacement name is formed from the adverb spisse (= densely) and the adjective
pilosus
(= hairy).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
=
Cryphalus striatus Browne, 1974: 66
syn. nov.
(secondary homonym).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks: A replacement name is proposed for
Cryphalus striatus Browne, 1974
because the name is now occupied by
Hypocryphalus striatus Hopkins, 1915
. The replacement name is a noun in the genitive case, named after the host plant
Storckiella
.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
=
Hypothenemus brownei Beaver, 1991: 53
syn. nov.
(unnecessary replacement name).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks:
Cryphalus striatulus ( Browne, 1978 )
is transferred to
Cryphalus
based on the external diagnostic characters visible. The replacement name is no longer necessary.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
=
Cryphalus indicus Stebbing, 1902: 403
(syn: Stebbing, 1914 ) (Permanently invalid name due to primary homonymy).
